instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Orbitron' font for all headings to give a strong sci-fi identity.
Use 'JetBrains Mono' for all code blocks, terminal inputs, and technical data displays.
The primary color is Neon Green (#00ff41). Use it for primary actions, success states, and terminal prompts.
The secondary color is Cyber Cyan (#00f3ff). Use it for links, information highlights, and secondary borders.
The accent color is Cyber Red (#ff003c). Use it strictly for errors, 'attack' simulations, and destructive actions.
Backgrounds should never be pure black (#000000) unless it's a terminal window. Use #050505 or #0a0a0a for page backgrounds.
Use 'Glassmorphism' for cards and overlays: bg-black/40 backdrop-blur-xl border border-white/5.
Implement a 'Bento Grid' layout for the Dashboard: mix large hero widgets with smaller stat cards.
For the Interactive Lab: Use a split-screen layout. Left side for instructions (scrollable), Right side for the Terminal (fixed).
Add 'data-testid' to all interactive elements for testing.
Ensure all text has sufficient contrast. Use white or off-white (#e0e0e0) for body text.
Do not use rounded corners for buttons or inputs. Keep them sharp (rounded-none or rounded-sm) to match the brutalist/cyberpunk aesthetic.
Use the provided image URLs for backgrounds and feature showcases. Do not use placeholders.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients.
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy.
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur).
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms.
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text.
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style.
